info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 09 at 4:00AM CST until November 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow, mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 10 inches, with potential for small areas of higher amounts and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, northwest and west central Minnesota. * WHEN...From late tonight through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Uncertainty remains for the areas that could receive the heaviest snow and timing and coverage of freezing rain or sleet. This will create large spread in potential impacts, and the storm track could still shift.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
